title: Electric power - determine if lightbulb is ohmic

content.description:
A student wants to determine if a resistor is ohmic. The student measures the current in the resistor and power dissipated by the resistor as the potential difference across the resistor is varied. The data are shown in the table.

Current In Resistor <math alttext="in amps" overflow="scroll"> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mtext>A</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>
 Power Dissipated by Resistor <math alttext="times 10 to the negative 8 power watt" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext><mo>)</mo></math>

<math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math>
 <math alttext="5.0" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn></math>

<math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math>
 <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn></math>

<math alttext="15" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn></math>
 <math alttext="45" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn></math>

<math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn></math>
 <math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn></math>

<math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn></math>
 <math alttext="125" overflow="scroll"><mn>125</mn></math>
content.question: Which of the following correctly indicates whether the resistor is ohmic and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: The resistor is not ohmic, because the power is a linear function of the current.
The resistor is not ohmic, because the power is a quadratic function of the current.
The resistor is ohmic, because the power is a linear function of the current.
The resistor is ohmic, because the power is a proportional to the square of the current.

content.answer: The resistor is ohmic, because the power is a proportional to the square of the current.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
